keyTakeAways: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, was fatally beaten by correctional officers upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024.
David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter; Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder and manslaughter charges.
The body-camera footage of the beating, though silent, showed guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, sparking public outrage and forming the core of the prosecution’s case.
The prosecution argued that all guards acted together as a gang, showing 'depraved indifference to human life,' with the charges of murder based on collective culpability.
Brooks suffered severe injuries including broken nose, black eye, and internal organ damage, with blood leaking into his lungs and stomach.
Kieffer pepper sprayed Brooks, Galliher attached shackles to his ankles, and Kingsley lifted him by the neck, according to both attorneys and video footage.
Six of the 10 guards indicted in February were charged with murder, with five pleading guilty to manslaughter and one to attempted tampering with evidence.
William Fitzpatrick, the special prosecutor, took over due to Attorney General Letitia James recusing herself to avoid conflicts in civil litigation.

Fitzpatrick is also prosecuting guards involved in the March 1, 2025, fatal beating of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility, indicating a broader pattern of accountability in prison violence.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, died after being brutally beaten upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024, with body-camera footage capturing the violence and public outrage. A jury found David Kingsley guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter, while Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges. The prosecution argued that all guards acted as a gang with 'depraved indifference to human life,' though the jury did not find the others guilty. Brooks suffered severe internal injuries, and the incident prompted broader scrutiny of prison guard conduct. William Fitzpatrick, the special prosecutor appointed after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself, is also investigating a similar beating at Mid-State Correctional Facility involving Messiah Nantwi, indicating a systemic pattern of violence in state prisons.
title: Former New York state prison guard found guilty in death of inmate beaten, 2 others acquitted
